website_summaries.verdict: This cooktop has great features for the price, as long as you don't mind its louder-than-average fan.
pros: Digital countdown digital timer with 1-minute increments up to 170 minutes
Turns off when you remove pan

customer_reviews.title: The fastest way to heat a pan/pot vs. electric or natural gas
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Heats up lightning fast and offers more control. One minute or less and you're up to 350°F from a cold pan. More energy efficient than gas or electric. Lighter than you'd think, making portability easy. Cools down quicker. Cons: Not all cookware works with induction. Don't trust material indicated, look for "induction ready" or the induction symbol on the pan. Ventilation fan is a bit loud and continues to cool the unit after you've finished cooking. Typically this is 2-3 minutes. Temperature control only works with food in the pan. If the pan is dry, or only has oil in it, it will get much hotter than you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Malfunction

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: in my opinion this product is not worth buying. its not a simple on and off and select the temp. when making your selection, sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. you have to play around with it. doesn't work with all frying pans. used it on and off a few times and stopped because it was such a task to even just cook anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: It’s a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because this was amazon recommended. But it shut on me on my 3rd cooking. And I wasn’t even using it for daily cooking. I was using for my videos so I used it lightly and only 3 times. So disappointed I’m returning this already and bought from other vendor in amazon. Hopefully that will work
customer_reviews.author: Selina R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality Product - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I used this induction cooktop burner twice. Once for about 1/2 hour and another for 3/4 hour at about 350-400F temperature. Both times I used it, I made sure I had proper ventilation and let the unit cool until the fan stopped on its own. The third time I used it, I got an E0 error. Thinking it was perhaps a bad outlet or stainless steel pot, I tried outlets on different circuit breakers and pots, but the E0 error remained. It is too late to send it back. I suspect that should you use this cooktop at higher temperatures, then it will get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: VERY poor heat distribution... a five inch circle at pan center heats to temperature however rest of pan is MUCH cooler. Bacon, as an example, must be cut into three inch pieces and moved into and out of pan center. It senses the center pan temperature only so it is impossible to regulate for full pan cooking. Using cast iron, BTW. Now, after a month’s use, it no longer works properly. The displays flashes and it continually ‘beeps’ before shutting down. Closely resembles a tilted pinball machine. No code just adios! What an overpriced and overrated piece of junk. Naturally the return window closed two weeks ago...
customer_reviews.author: Octopusrex

customer_reviews.title: Not much lasting quality
customer_reviews.text: It's been a little more than 2 months now and after only using it roughly 7-8 times the thing died on me. Does not power on most of the time and when it does the plate no longer gets remotely warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this to anybody
customer_reviews.text: This thing only seems to be working well with a large pot or pan. With smaller pots you keep getting the error that it doesn’t recognize the cookware (EO). And forget about using a small (6 inch) pan or pot on it because that does not work at all. All my cookware is induction ready. Would not recommend this to anybody!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait to use!  Be certain it is working when you receive!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have opportunity to like anything about this item. I had owner one from a different mfg. the previous year and loved it. Gave to a friend she loved so much. I then replaced with this one since reviews were good and always rely on Amazon. Sadly I just opened tonight after having it since Nov.4, 2017! Shocked beyond belief when it would give me only a message : EO! No heat, no ability to do anything beyond this EO message. Reading reviews from those who gave product 0\1 star I read several people had received same EO message. A true killer! So very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Katch

customer_reviews.title: Not as efficient as stated
customer_reviews.text: The device appears well made and appearance is nice, I do not get the performance touted in comparison to my gas stove. For example, boiling water for a 4 qt pot takes 25 minutes on my gas stove. On the Induction countertop I finally gave up after an hour. This is using All-Clad Copper Core cookware made for induction cooking. The control of temperature for low levels is very nice. My main reasons for getting this use within my RV during inclement weather or needing additional cooking space beyond my grill. I think it will do the job but for those getting this for fuel efficiency are likely to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product about 1.5 years ago and it has stopped working. I have only used it once in a while, not more than 20 times. It is giving me error messages as soon as I turn it on now. I understand it is no longer under warranty.....
customer_reviews.author: Jmat

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the BEST portable heating unit I've used! Heats up quickly and I love the timer on it as well. This is perfect for our family gatherings where I need to keep food hot without using the microwave or sterno cans. I've purchased two of those cheap portable burners and they don't heat up enough and over a very short period of time, they stopped working! I will be purchasing a few more of these in the future. Thank you for a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Carmella R. Musgrove

customer_reviews.title: I have to give it a star,  1, but only because i have to.
customer_reviews.text: Leave this piece of junk alone. We have been full time RVING for 5 years, we have used an induction cook top that long. We finally decided to replace the old one because I thought it was not cooking as well as it had been. After using this piece of junk, my 5 year old one cooks way better than this new one. I don't keep junk around that don't work, i'm not a hoarder, going back to the old one, this goes to the garbage dump.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature Sensor Intermittent Failure After 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: My bad, I assumed a one year warranty, it is a two year warranty or I would have had this covered. I really like this cooktop. It heats rapidly and evenly. The controls are very accurate. Until January of 2020, after 18 months of ownership when my pans would heat up well above the set temperature on initial warm up. Then some times while cooking the temperature will drop below the set point and I need to raise the temperature to keep cooking. Not sure if I will replace this unit with an identical unit or not. My bad for not making a warranty claim, but I wonder if my next one would fail after two years.
customer_reviews.author: Admiralbrown

customer_reviews.title: Just barely outlived the return window
customer_reviews.text: If it worked it would be a great product. It was acting up (pan sensor quit working and only provided heat on heat level 10) after a couple days and I was going to return it. The next day, it seemed to be a fluke so I just kept it instead of exchanging for a new one -- it worked *just* long enough to get out of the return period. Very disappointed, and since it works intermittently, I doubt the warranty will do anything. Pretty sure I'm out $70.
customer_reviews.author: asdfg

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed using for nearly 4 years but not trying to find replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Its fast and probably cheaper to run than any other electric cook top. In summer when heat is the enemy in the house when running the A/C. This unit doesn't waste much heat when cooking. Setting a timer every time you cook can be handy if you multi task like me. The two downsides for us. Fan is noisy when its cold. The heat from the glass eventually transfers to the plastic and eventually cracks and/or distort it. Temp is more of a guide. This will probably work for another 4 years if the manufacturer can supply a new plastic top cover. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah, this is so great. Why don't more people use induction? It's fast and easy and my preferred method of heating. Even though I have a full kitchen with electric burners this is much faster and provides an even heat. The biggest negative which doesn't go into my star rating is just a general statement that you need to use certain pans and they have to be flat. At first I didn't have the best pans and they would shake back and fourth on the burner. That being said, something like a tea kettle heats up so fast, it's great. No more waiting for tea in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Jean

customer_reviews.title: Fan and coil are both super noisy, unit has very poor regulation at low power levels
customer_reviews.text: This unit is functional, and can give a lot of output. So if you just want to boil water or so, it might be fine. But for use at low settings, it is very coarse. The high-pitched coil whine is loud and obnoxious and genuinely unpleasant to be around. Also, the fan is on at a high speed all the time, and it stays on for several minutes even after you turn the thing off. I know the unit is cheap. But you can tell it's cheap when you use it – in every single aspect. The good reviews I have seen gave me the impression this has a "good-for-the-money" feel. I would instead say it has a "get-what-you-pay-for" feel.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: Fast pick up but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Induction stove was my dream because it is highly reviewed. Few things to consider, only iron based utensils will be compatible. If your kitchen is stacked with non-iron, then you will have to buy those. Heat picked up really quick. I like that. The most annoying feature is fan noise. I used propane stove for my YouTube videos and that was noisy, so I switched to electric coil, but that was slow in heat pick up and slow in cooling down. So, I switched to induction. Now heating and cooling is faster, however, the noise is bothering my kids and my camera records it. So, choice is yours.
customer_reviews.author: Nandhu

customer_reviews.title: Loud, in a way that I'm sure can cause ear damage.
customer_reviews.text: We had this while redoing our kitchen. It is SO loud if you turn it up to anything but low settings. It's a squealing electric sound that goes RIGHT through your skull. My husband is hard of hearing and not sensitive to high-pitched frequencies. I'm not being dramatic, but there were a couple of times he turned it up on high while I was in the room, and it made me scream reflexively or knocked me over. I ended up barely using it (just on low, with earplugs in) because it feels dangerous to be near it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S. Chalas

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for one thing-
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly what we need, but there’s a strange issue with it- when you turn the temp up to its highest setting, it emits a really jaw-clenching high-pitched ring. Not loud, but just enough to be intolerable. The setting goes to 10, and you begin to hear the noise at level 8.
customer_reviews.author: Rc

customer_reviews.title: Work well for the price
customer_reviews.text: Price is very budget and the cooker look good. We have this for a year now and it’s still going strong. used it almost every other day to take Videos during our food recipe cooking/demonstration. Only complain i have is the heat output, high on it is like medium and so on as compare to our full size. Thus it takes longer to cook anything, other than that it’s quite well for the price
customer_reviews.author: Victoria G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but a bit loud
customer_reviews.text: We are in the middle of a kitchen renovation and needed a way to cook meals while things are torn up. Since we're getting an induction cooktop, we picked one of these up for practice. It's worked out well for us. Easy to use, easy to clean, heats up fast, etc. Docking a star because it's loud, and for some reason it drives my son nuts when it's turned on. Lol. Like a teenage boy dog whistle or something. Anyway, if you're looking for a single burner, I'd recommend this one as long as you have induction ready cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Great to have but...
customer_reviews.text: Portable, easy to clean and heats up water quickly to a boil. I used the cook top outside to deep fry ribs. The oil heat up reasonably quickly. However, after adding the ribs to deep fry and seeing the subsequent temperature drop, the time it took to get back to the original desired deep frying temperature was longer than I expected...almost as long as an electric stove and no where near as quickly as a gas stove. Still, it's nice to have so that I can deep fry outside and not stink up the house.
customer_reviews.author: Buddha

customer_reviews.title: SMALL HEATING AREA. SURFACE GETS HOT - INDUCTION SHOULD NOT!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product! 1. Induction heat is a magnetic field and should not be hot... but the first thing you see when you open this is a warning label saying it gets hot! 2. If you look at the picture of the product it has a double circle on it, however, only the inner circle gets hot, so if you put any pot/pan over 6” wide on it the outer edge does not cook while the middle burns. 3. The fan is very loud and annoying. I bought two of these and because I didn’t use them right away I cannot return them... waste of 120.00!
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: First time out of box and it does not work ...
customer_reviews.text: First time out of box and it does not work! So disappointing. We purchased this for use in our camper and it has been sitting in the box until our first camping trip so it has been a few months since purchase and is outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 4 years ago for my son to use in his dorm room to heat soup, etc safely. I bought this for myself mostly for energy savings in the summer months. This is just awesome. I have an electric stove that uses resistance coils, and it takes some time to cook and boil water. This does it in minutes, with little wasted heat or electricity. between this cooktop and a recent toaster oven purchase, 've knocked 1/3-1/2 of my electricity bill the first week I've used them. It also saves a great deal of time, and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable nor would I recommend it to anyone else
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about 3 uses. Not dependable nor would I recommend it to anyone else. Very disappointed as when I took it out of the box it appeared sturdy and well made. Fit all my pans well.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Efficient stovetop cooks a great dinner in time.
customer_reviews.text: This stovetop is amazing! I switched from a standard electric stovetop and broke and now I’m glad the old one broke! This new pan heats up so insanely fast, keeps its heat very well and heats pans so evenly. Bye bye to the cold pan edges! I cannot use my stove at my house so this is my replacement for everyday cooking and it certainly gets the job done. Buttons make sense, cord is good, cooktop is sturdy. My only complaint would be that there seems to be some white noise associated with the heating maybe because of the magnets? But you will get over it and it’s mostly in the beginning of cooking. Thanks Wirecutter for recommending this!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: I like the concept but it is 30 degrees off
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept but it is 30 degrees off. Water doesnt boil at 180 degrees. I ask service on how to recalibrate which most induction units can do, and they asked for proof of puchase. Well here is my proof. Dont buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Schnaper

customer_reviews.title: Serious durability issues
customer_reviews.text: I’m an avid home cook and use mine as a primary burner. These burners simply aren’t durable. I purchased my first one in January 2018. A year later, in January 2019, just before the warranty expired, the plastic rim started to split. Secura issued a replacement. Fast forward to June 2020; the replacement unit display is starting to flicker wildly. I am out of warranty and SOL. If you’re using a 12 or larger pan, go with a different unit; preferably one with metal housing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Does not boil water any faster than my gas stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit along with a pasta pot that is made for induction cooking. It took longer to boil water than my gas stove does which defeats the purpose. Temperature regulation did not work well either. My cast iron pan was either lukewarm or 500 degrees. The fan cooling the unit is annoyingly loud. I already threw out the box and the cooktop is going to follow it straight to the garbage bin.
customer_reviews.author: Goetz Schuppan

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooktop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Cooktop as temporary replacement while my Kitchen Aid 4 burner Cooktop is on warranty repair. It is still not fixed doe to Kitchen Aid technician do not know their own product. It is over 3 months now. Do not buy Kitchen Aid. This burner is great and I feel bad that I will not have usage for this burner after my cooktop is repaired. I highly recommend this cooktop. Only thing that I do not like is very stiff power cable, but this is issue only if receptacle is very close to this cooktop.
customer_reviews.author: Branko Bem

customer_reviews.title: The future is NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I have always sworn by gas because of the temperature control. Now I will always look at gas as antiquated and unnecessarily dangerous. I purchased this to keep water for tea at the perfect temperature. It has quickly become the only burner I use, even though I have a stove with three gas burners. From now on I'll only use induction.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rocha

customer_reviews.title: I love this induction cooktop!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: It heats faster than my regular stove. I love that I can control the heat by number or by temperature. I also love the built in timer. I can leave something simmering for a specific time and no longer worry that I will forget it and allow it to burn. It is very easy to clean. It is portable. I can use my cast iron pans without fear. CONS: A specific type pan is needed, so I can no longer use all the Corningware I have collected through the years. My aluminum frying pans no longer work either.
customer_reviews.author: Bevs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cast iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy a new oven, and due to cost constraints I had to get an electric ceramic/glass cooktop. Talk about a delicate cooktop... wow. So I purchased this for my cast iron cooking. It cooks on the larger ring, some people say it doesn’t. It needs to be preheated, either in the oven or on the low heat cycle on the cooktop, never leave the cooktop unattended. It did a great job. Searing steaks to finish in the oven & stir frying.
customer_reviews.author: Plantina

customer_reviews.title: The only drawback is that it makes a high pitch squeal that gets pretty bad at levels 9+
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. The only drawback is that it makes a high pitch squeal that gets pretty bad at levels 9+. It gets so bad that my kids run into the other room because it's painful for them. It appears to be a pitch that only affects them (since younger kids can hear higher ranges).
customer_reviews.author: MilitaryMan

customer_reviews.title: Showed EO and not working any more when tried to use it the second time
customer_reviews.text: I found it’s not working any more since used it when I first bought it a few months ago. The display shows “ EO” and kept flashing. and the fan loud.
customer_reviews.author: TinTin Q

customer_reviews.title: Can't control temperature!
customer_reviews.text: Too hot or too cool. Replaced a well used 7 year old Nuwave with this unit (9100MC). First use resulted in a burned, well seasoned 16 year old Lodge cast iron skillet. Temperature was set at 320 then reduced to 300. Skillet temperature measured with a laser infrared thermometer was >485. Temperature below 300 (280) was too cool to cook with. It would appear that the thermostat on this unit is defective. Thanks to Amazons easy return policy I am returning this unit and will purchase another Nuwave.
customer_reviews.author: KaTee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my gas stove while we are renovating the kitchen. Absolutely in love with how quickly it heats up everything. Put it to the test and it boils water in half the time as the gas range. Heat distribution is eaven and it heats up in no time. The fan is a bit noisy at times but not too bothersome. Highly recommend and will keep it now for buffets and dinner parties.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A very disappointing heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this cooktop. The concept of heating the pot instead of the stove was really appealing. The truth is that it is almost unusable. I have spent a considerable amount of time with an infrared thermometer confirming what my cooking results have shown me. The temperatures in various places in the pan can vary by 150° or more. Not only that but the variance is rather uneven. Pancakes can be not cooking in some places and burning in others.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Pelc

customer_reviews.title: Works great...
customer_reviews.text: Used the 8100MC heavly for years. After the top came loose, I upgraded to the 9100MC. Smooth quick even heat. Adjustable. Cooking is no guesswork. Got rid of popcorn maker and fryer. Set the timer and things are done. Got a 1950 drip coffee maker and heat water in 6 minutes. Put some oil in pan and 1/2 cup popcorn 6 minutes later 4 cups popcorn. Only warning is to not let it boil over and let water suck into the machine. Beats gas and electric burners.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Potochnik

customer_reviews.title: Overall, we like it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cooktop to try out induction cooking. So far we really like using it. Choosing the right cookware to use on it helps as well. Some of our pots worked better than others, and of course some of them wouldn't work at all. We did notice that it will turn itself off after a time (i.e. simmering a pot of chili for an hour) and had to turn it back on. Overall, we like this unit.
customer_reviews.author: wdwind1

customer_reviews.title: Great but get to know the heat settings.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great product. But the minor caveat is getting the heat setting right. You have to adapt to it's settings as medium is like medium high on a normal range. Once you get the hang of the heat output you'll be whipping up your cooked dishes faster than a conventional electric range and I think it heats pots & pans faster than gas. I've had it for a while and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar A. Frank

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend a device that breaks down after not even 10 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March for an apartment where I'm practically never. I used it a dozen times maximum. No longer works, ventilation starts very quickly and that's it. It does not heat anymore and displays E0. I have tried everything. I do not recommend a device that breaks down after not even 10 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature incremental adjustments not as fine as NuWave but....
customer_reviews.text: ....product seems better made as their touch control doesn't have rubber pads that will eventually wear through. While their temperature increments aren't as many as NuWave, that really doesn't matter as most cooking is really done on the power settings (1-10 relating to low-high). The fan puts out a bit more noise than NuWave, but that's simply a minor inconvenience. This was a replacement for my NuWave that broke due to the way they design their digital controls (the on-off button pushed right through the front panel). Besides being quite a bit less expensive, this machine does everything the NuWave did. So far I'm quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Temp fluctuates quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: Temp fluctuates quite a bit more so than my nu-wave and seems to have uneven heating. I bought this one because i was looking for a larger heating surface but i cant really tell much difference in this and my nu-wave except that this on seems to have a hot spot. Wish it had been what i was looking for but it isn't, but it does work. I know that induction hot plates and even stove tops fluctuates in heating, just the way they work, but this one seems to cool way down before it heats back up.
customer_reviews.author: walkjk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when I received it.
customer_reviews.text: Kept showing error code- EO. I made sure it was on a flat surface and had enough ventilation on my countertop. However, I noticed it wasn't balanced. The pads on the bottom were not even and could not be adjusted, which is what I'm assuming is the problem. Unfortunately, I missed the window to return it since I just opened it so I guess I'm stuck with it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Someone was really confused when they designed this
customer_reviews.text: You have an option to switch from a 1 thru ten system or degrees, which make more sense but why do I have to switch it to degrees every time I use it? I want to cook this on a five, a seven, a two? based on what? It makes no sense and it does not accammodate really low temperatures for melting chocolates, which is what I purchased this for. My old New Wave was much better, had a wider temperature range and lasted 10 years. I miss my old New Wave Convection Cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It fits everything!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! It fits all of my good ale Cruset and stock pot. It’s larger than I expected but that’s because I have such a tiny kitchen. It’s much better than the electric burners and I currently have.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Hot
customer_reviews.text: Since I have started using this cooktop I have hardly used my range. It is much faster than my range and temperature is easier to control. I find the set temperature can be much different than the pan temperature maybe because the cookware I have has small indented areas in the middle of the bottom. I think it takes some getting used to as anything does. When I cook scrambled eggs they cook very fast on the 140 degree F setting. All in all I am satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: TomG

customer_reviews.title: No More Stove!
customer_reviews.text: I love this guy! Nothing sticks to it. It cleans easily. Yes, it does have the tendency to make a high pitch noise, but I only notice it when it's on high heat. It boils water CRAZY fast, which is awesome. Now that I have this, I've been reheating leftovers the old fashioned way. It takes just as long as the microwave because it heats evenly - no stirring and putting back in for 2 minutes. My next stove will be induction for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in SoDak

customer_reviews.title: Cook indoors or outdoors. Perfection cooking
customer_reviews.text: I own an induction burner it was so hot this summer I choise to cook out doors. I had invited a friend to dinner. I made chicken tika masala, my friend liked the dinner. The star was my induction burner. I purchased another one as a Christmas gift. The second i turn it on, my Copper induction pan is hot and ready to go. I hope it makes it under the tree, you. Cook in it, serve from it and it's also a warmer. It's amazing
customer_reviews.author: Just4fun

customer_reviews.title: A high-pitch noise that kids may pick up more readily?
customer_reviews.text: The cooktop looks and works great and heats up water in my stainless steel pot very fast. Seems easy to use as well. Only complaint was from my 10-year-old son who claimed to have heard a high-pitch noise that both my wife and I did not hear. I thought he made it up so tried to shift power levels around while he was not paying attention to the cooking (fan was working so background noise was there). It seemed the higher power I switched to, the more alert he became so most likely it was real and we had to put earplugs on him... Other than that, everything works great!
customer_reviews.author: wazys_jzfloch

customer_reviews.title: ... my first experience with this technology and I really like it. I would give this a 5 star ...
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months of very little use, the cooling fan inside is make a horrendous noise. The case on the left is cracked even though the cook top has never been dropped or abused. The cook top has two circles on top that suggest to me that the heating area depends on the size of your pot. This is not the case. The heating is done on the small circle area only. This makes for very poor heat distribution on large pots and burning of your food in the center. It has the word expert written on the surface. This is not an expert cooking device. I recommend you look at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: MBINA

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best cooktop I have ever used. If you like Gas stoves for the control but have to move to electric, go with induction. I was a little concerned that a 110v cooktop along with the efficiency loss of induction, I wouldn't be completely happy with this but I was pleasantly surprised that this worked so well. Another bonus is this gave me an excuse to buy new cookware as my old stuff was stainless or aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hodges

customer_reviews.title: I love this burner!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I hardly ever write reviews but I must, . I love this burner works just like a stove top would. Only thing I didn't realize is that you need a certain size pot to use this otherwise it gives you an error message. For it to work you have to place pot on top for it to heat, it pot is too large even though pot may seem to fit fine it does not turn on to heat but gives you a error message to replace pot. Otherwise wow, it's awesome. Cooks great, all temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Dos Reis

customer_reviews.title: Super Pleased Secura
customer_reviews.text: We've remodeled our kitchen a few years ago..and purchased this for the need to keep feeding our family...without our regular stove. Weird thing is.. we still use this.. ! It's the best. Easy peasy, safe cooking, quick cleaning and simple storing in a cupboard. I highly recommend this perfect cooking for everyone.. keeping it simple....a lovely concept for the ever complicated life. Ikr? ♡
customer_reviews.author: Mopsie

customer_reviews.title: Glamping
customer_reviews.text: This is the second portable induction cooktop I have purchased! This is fabulous for use in our 5th wheel. Heats up and cools down quickly. It is cooking in the fast lane and therefore takes a small time getting used to......well worth the time and effort! Love using.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: What a great product!
customer_reviews.text: We live in our motor home and use this burner nearly every day and love it. It works much better than the propane cook top and feel like it is safer. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: The Johnson family

customer_reviews.title: Fast heating and easy temperature control
customer_reviews.text: This really heats up quickly, much much faster than my old countertop burner. Good points, fast, good temp control, even a timer so your food won't overcook if you accidentally forget it. Drawback: you have to buy all new cookware because the pots need to be magnetic. Cast iron works as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nannette

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this burner
customer_reviews.text: When my wonderful induction range broke I chose to replace it with a regular electric range because I learned that induction ranges frequently break. I was quite sad. During the weeks without a range I bought this induction burner. Even though I now have a perfectly nice 4-burner electric range, I continue to use this induction burner daily. I love it and it works perfectly well. Induction rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Grateful1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hotplate!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived super-fast! My induction range temperature control was acting wacky. Serviceman came but am awaiting for part to arrive. In the meantime, I needed a hotplate to cook on. Really appreciated that this shipped to me so quickly. During this pandemic, don’t want to go out for meals as our household consists of all high risk seniors in our seventies. Thank you for sending this induction hotplate to me so expeditiously.
customer_reviews.author: Hi96768

customer_reviews.title: This works quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a wheelchair and can no longer reach the stove, this unit saved me. I love to cook and this cooktop saved me by being able to continue preparing my own healthy food. Good job, it has all the bells and whistles I need, only complaint I have is that the heat circle could be larger to compensate a 12" pan or pot.
customer_reviews.author: Marion S.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to make hot pot at home. Worked well the furst time but Stopped working the second time i used it. Doesnt seem like i can return or replace. Definitely would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t get mine to work.
customer_reviews.text: Error message straight out of the box. I couldn’t get mine to work.
customer_reviews.author: I.T.D.

customer_reviews.title: Fast heating, good power control, a bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: A bit noisy, but otherwise great, easy to clean with no areas on top for liquids to get into device. Wish it was a bit more stylish. The duty cycle (element switching on and off at low power settings) was not that noticeable to me in terms of heat fluctuation, but you could hear it clicking on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: temperature inaccurate, unreliable, and erratic.
customer_reviews.text: the lowest temp i could get it to produce is 165f, and even that isn't reliable. it even got up to 340f once while set at 140f! returning.
customer_reviews.author: generic

customer_reviews.title: it was great. Now I plug it in and it trips ...
customer_reviews.text: While it was working, it was great. Now I plug it in and it trips the breaker. It was used a few times since we purchased it in August. Surely it should last longer than that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use it almost daily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see what all the hype about induction cooking was. I’ve been pleasantly surprised. After researching various cooktops, I went with this one and I’m not disappointed. My only grumble and I’ve not seen it anywhere else is that ideally you need two. This is now my go to choice for cooking until I buy a full size range / cooker with more than one surface. That said, very happy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you like induction cooking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my wife to use when we are in the RV. It has worked very well and is actually our second portable induction cooktop. It does everything it claims to do and is a nice way to save propane in the camper assuming you have ac power available. It's easy to move outside for cooking those more odoriferous items (read fish). If you already have cookware that will work with the induction stove then go ahead and "pull the trigger". It has worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Aviator007

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt provide cooking heat nor consistent cooking heat
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy customer -- do not buy. Using induction cookware material (cast iron), the induction cooktop does not heat the cookware. It either never gets to the correct tempurate (tempurate where it is set) and/or loses heating power after a few minutes of use. Not a happy customer. Bought within 3 months but Amazon will not let me return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Love this...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been meaning to review this for a long time. I’ve had it for a year, so reliable is a given. I use it commercially in a microbrewery... we do pizzas and charcuterie. I use it primarily for the pizza toppings... chicken, sausage, caramelized onion, etc. although we do specials too. It gets a lot of use. I love this cooktop... it’s been a lifesaver. Durable, reliable, consistent heat... did I say love? I need more of these. Another reviewer mentioned that it was noisy... and that the fan failed. In my experience there is no noise other than the food cooking... and have not had any issues with the cooling fan. I plan to buy more of these...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the RV
customer_reviews.text: The husband and I were tired of trying to use the propane in our rv. After 30 min and no boiling we ordered one of these. Two days later and we had hot water instantly. I love this little burner. Quick evenly cooked meals. No more propane and we couldn’t be more happy.
customer_reviews.author: L. G. Saya

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, but fast.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest downfall to this induction burner is that it is loud. That being said we usually use it at least once a day and it has held up well and is more preferred when cooking in our home due to its speed. This is over our what was brand new $1000+ range and oven. We have had it for almost a year and then bought 2 more as presents for a couple people. I would had have reccomended it.
customer_reviews.author: huntingstill

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect product for a small guest cottage!
customer_reviews.text: We are staying in a friend's guest cottage while we wait for our home to be rebuild after the fires of 2017 in California. This is saving us! The perfect product for a small space and works so well with our induction pots! Seriously, no issues! In fact it has convinced us to order a convention range for our rebuilt home!
customer_reviews.author: hilary young

customer_reviews.title: Crazy nice,  but could use a tweak
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Minus one star because there's nothing to stop almost any pan from sliding off. Not that it has but there should be a ridge or a texture or something to help mitigate the ice rink slickness. As it is now we pretty well sit close and stare at it.
customer_reviews.author: Sintillator

customer_reviews.title: Space-saving design, cooks great, but wow-- watch that heat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a very small break room at work, and it's wonderful! It's very noisy, but I suppose it has to be. Only thing I would suggest to new buyers: Try a range of temperatures before you decide that "1 means low, and 9 means high". I thought I could cook some eggs on "medium" (5), and it totally roasted them in a matter of seconds, burning everything in sight. I found the sweet-spot to be 3 to 3.5.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: No longer standing over the stovetop.
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this induction cooktop. I purchased because I got sick of cleaning my gas range after cooking foods that tend to splatter. I didn’t know I’d be using it all the time. True temperature control is something I’ve never experienced before. I no longer have to watch over something on the stove, how quick or how slow something is cooking. It’s also great for the backyard barbecue or pancakes on the patio. Now I’m outside with everyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful cooktop, fully customizable. I like the termp control you get with this and the temp is true and accurate. I tried another and returned it, this on is much better, haven't used the stove since I got it. Easy to clean, doesn't heat up the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: dorie k.

customer_reviews.title: Basically now is useless.
customer_reviews.text: Working very but after 5 months of infrequent use the burner keeps turning off while in use. Basically now is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Anacoring

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Jubk
customer_reviews.text: First of all it doesn't heat that much faster than conventional electric portable stove. Secondly it only lasted 7 months until it read E for error and stopped working. I barely used it maybe 4 or 5 times a month. There is no warranty except 30 days return policy. Piece of junk, I would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: magnetic, cast iron and carbon steel needed
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it will work. I wasn’t aware there are only three types of metal that work on an induction top stove - magnetic bottom, cast iron and carbon steel (not stainless steel). So, now I have to purchase these types of pans just to get it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: M M P

customer_reviews.title: It can cook hot and fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just used it the first time. I bought it to cook fish outside on the patio. I seared a nice steak in it last night it worked perfectly. I like how sturdy and well-made it is. The pan continues cooking after removed from the unit. So it is a learning process, but easy one. The steak was beautifully rare to medium rare with a great sear! So far, great!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystalcowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this burner. It worked better than others we tried. We had zero complaints. Until today. Today, for no reason whatsoever, the unit died. Dim lights showed up across the display but unit won’t cut on at all. This burner came with a 2 year manufacture warranty but we are six months past that. For the amount of money we spent, it should last more than two and a half years.
customer_reviews.author: 😍😘

customer_reviews.title: Works like a regular cooktop.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this unit. It heats up quickly and evenly and I’m able to use it just like my regular cooktop. Only one design flaw, in my opinion. The power light and the on/off light are the same so it looks like the unit is on even when it’s not. Overall, though, an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: lppardue

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal and a tremendous time saver
customer_reviews.text: We are apartment dwellers so no open flame (BBQ) allowed. I was looking for a way to get a real deep sear on steaks without filling the place with smoke. I use this on the patio and it gets my cast iron pan smoking hot in minutes. I cook the steaks sous vide in the kitchen and then finish them off in the cast iron skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I bought and have been using it for 2 month ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought and have been using it for 2 month now and got a huge crack on the edge because of the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Bank of America

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for heating oil for deep frying; much better temperature control. On the stove I tend to have it too high or too low, but this makes it easier for me. Just be sure to use the right type of pot/pan. Plus, it doesn’t use up our propane.
customer_reviews.author: Paul & Cindi

customer_reviews.title: If you are into Sous Vide....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could go outside and sear steaks. I cook Sous Vide often. This is perfect for that. I use a 9 inch cast iron crepe pan. At the highest power setting I got the skillet to 580°F. 40 seconds a side for the steak came out perfect. I did use a extra large bacon press on top during the sear.
customer_reviews.author: GreatNameforabandcom

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited for this! So far I’ve only used it twice. Omit was a little harder to follow direction for what temperature to put things on to cook with so I’ve just used it to boil water mostly. Will update when I’ve cooked on it!
customer_reviews.author: SBonney

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love to have this extra "eye" to cook on. We initially bought it to use w/ generator when the power goes out, due to all the storms we have had; but, found that it is very handy to have for omelets, etc. when cooking other dishes on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W Stilts

customer_reviews.title: no complaints besides the unit finally failing and the size of the induction element.
customer_reviews.text: worked awesome until both units I owned failed after 3 and 4 years. no complaints besides the unit finally failing and the size of the induction element. will be looking into a more professional unit now in hopes that it'll actually last.
customer_reviews.author: Jack K

customer_reviews.title: Love my Duxtop
customer_reviews.text: Living in Hawaii, many apartments do not have stoves, they generally come with a toaster over and two burner hot plate. I purchased this when the hot plates burnt out in a year, and this product is awesome. I can boil a pot of water in 3 min, cook a special omelet in 2-3 min. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. H. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Works great, meets my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I really like this unit. It is a little bit loud, and the plastic is a little bit flexible, but after using it as our only cooking surface for about a month (our old stove died), it definitely does the trick. I just wish I had 1-2 more of them.
customer_reviews.author: chivyguitar

customer_reviews.title: Extreamely uncomfortable noise
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, Horrible, Horrible; I cannot understand how the other people consider this induction pot as "not noisy". In fact, I could not imagine an induction pot is "noisy" until I received THIS ONE. It generates extreamely uncomfortable noise just as someone is scratching a blckborad by nails, and of course, caused my headache.
customer_reviews.author: Chunyang Ni

customer_reviews.title: Check what type of of cookware you own before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t use this on my trip because of my new Caphlon pan wasn’t compatible. I didn’t understand that it was a pan restricted to a certain type. I couldn’t return this also because I was one day late.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Kamar

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use; heats quickly and gets quite ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use; heats quickly and gets quite hot for searing. I found I needed a lower temperature than it has to cook some beans for a long period of time in a small pot. I had to keep turning it off for a bit then back on. Each time you turn it on, it goes back to a medium setting. after a while I forgot to immediately turn it down and ended up over cooking my dish. But a small inconvenience. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: WHAT IS THERE NOT TO LOVE?
customer_reviews.text: Versatile, heats very rapidly and cools down so fast! I purchased this to use on my patio and it's a superb addition. I looked at several different models and went with this one based on reviews and price--no regrets! Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Vero

customer_reviews.title: love this portable counter top induction burner
customer_reviews.text: love this portable counter top induction burner! It saved the holidays for me. Our induction cooktop went out before Thanksgiving and it is still out in Jan ...Bought this and it works great! Induction cooking is very fast and efficient with the 2 types of power it solved my problem of no cooktop for now
customer_reviews.author: Helen Krouse

customer_reviews.title: Induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I am learning how to cook with this. I am disappointed that it did not come with a better guide as to what temperatures or power levels to use with what type of food. I did find a chart online and printed it.
customer_reviews.author: gailann

product_meta.title: Duxtop 1800W Portable Induction Cooktop Countertop Burner, Black 9100MC/BT-M20B
feature_bullets: PORTABLE INDUCTION BURNER Duxtop induction cooktop uses 120V 15 amp electrical outlet–standard in all North American homes. ETL listed and built to North American electrical standards. Lightweight, portable induction cooktop makes handling and storage easy. Perfect for dorm rooms, home kitchens, backyard cooking, RVs, boats, etc.

HIGH EFFICIENCY Choose from 15 preset power levels 200W to 1800W and 15 preset temperature level settings 140 F to 460 F. With an 83 percentage energy efficiency rating, induction cooker is more efficient than traditional gas or electric stoves yet provides quick heat-up and faster cooking times

EASY TO CLEAN & VIEW With no open flame or heating element, food does not burn on the oversized glass cooktop, making the induction burner easy to clean just wipe with a damp towel. The angle control panel with a large display screen, providing easy viewing, even from a distance.

REQUIRES INDUCTION READY COOKWARE Induction stoves rely on cookware to heat, so it’s essential to choose magnetic bottom cookware with a minimum diameter of 5 inches. The auto-pan detection will shut the unit off automatically after 60 seconds if no cookware, or the incorrect cookware is detected.
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED Please allow the induction hot plate to cool down before cleaning. If you have any questions with our product, please feel free to contact our customer service.
